values.description:
This addresses an issue that was [reported here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/49/consolidate-the-binary-output-directories/diff#comment-57357294).

We want to make sure that we don't accidentally override a newer version of `ign-cmake` with an older version.

Also, from now on this `ign-cmake0` branch will be the branch for any further bug fixes that are needed in `ign-cmake0`, so make sure to not close this branch when merging.
values.title: Guard against accidentally switching to older versions of ign-cmake

summary.raw:
This addresses an issue that was [reported here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/49/consolidate-the-binary-output-directories/diff#comment-57357294).

We want to make sure that we don't accidentally override a newer version of `ign-cmake` with an older version.

Also, from now on this `ign-cmake0` branch will be the branch for any further bug fixes that are needed in `ign-cmake0`, so make sure to not close this branch when merging.
summary.html:
This addresses an issue that was reported here.

We want to make sure that we don't accidentally override a newer version of ign-cmake with an older version.

Also, from now on this ign-cmake0 branch will be the branch for any further bug fixes that are needed in ign-cmake0, so make sure to not close this branch when merging.

values.description:
Debian uses the BUILD\_TYPE `None`as default in the debhelper when using cmake as buildtype. They set the flags in the environment variables instead of using the cmake optimizations.

I'm adding to the option of `None`minimal setups like the warning flags for gcc/clang/msvc
values.title: Suport for CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE None

summary.raw:
Debian uses the BUILD\_TYPE `None`as default in the debhelper when using cmake as buildtype. They set the flags in the environment variables instead of using the cmake optimizations.

I'm adding to the option of `None`minimal setups like the warning flags for gcc/clang/msvc
summary.html:
Debian uses the BUILD_TYPE Noneas default in the debhelper when using cmake as buildtype. They set the flags in the environment variables instead of using the cmake optimizations.

I'm adding to the option of Noneminimal setups like the warning flags for gcc/clang/msvc

values.description:
The `Requires` field in a project's `.pc` file was blank because of a variable name change.

There are a few other variables that looks suspicious ( @mxgrey ): 

1. `PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES_PRIVATE`
2. `PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_LIBS_PRIVATE`
values.title: Fix pkgconfig requires

summary.raw:
The `Requires` field in a project's `.pc` file was blank because of a variable name change.

There are a few other variables that looks suspicious ( @mxgrey ): 

1. `PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES_PRIVATE`
2. `PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_LIBS_PRIVATE`
summary.html:
The Requires field in a project's .pc file was blank because of a variable name change.

There are a few other variables that looks suspicious ( @mxgrey ):

  1. PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES_PRIVATE

values.description:
The recent addition of components introduced some greater complexity in sorting out core library dependencies from component dependencies when generating pkgconfig files. I made sure to test that component dependencies were being sorted correctly, but it seems I overlooked core library dependencies.

This PR fixes the logic for identifying core library dependencies for pkgconfig. The issue was essentially caused by a misplaced cmake variable dereference.
values.title: Fix pkgconfig type logic for core project libraries

summary.raw:
The recent addition of components introduced some greater complexity in sorting out core library dependencies from component dependencies when generating pkgconfig files. I made sure to test that component dependencies were being sorted correctly, but it seems I overlooked core library dependencies.

This PR fixes the logic for identifying core library dependencies for pkgconfig. The issue was essentially caused by a misplaced cmake variable dereference.
summary.html:
The recent addition of components introduced some greater complexity in sorting out core library dependencies from component dependencies when generating pkgconfig files. I made sure to test that component dependencies were being sorted correctly, but it seems I overlooked core library dependencies.

This PR fixes the logic for identifying core library dependencies for pkgconfig. The issue was essentially caused by a misplaced cmake variable dereference.

values.description:
I'm planning to add more tests, and I wanted to adjust the variable names in the junit templates so they make more sense.

`EXAMPLE_NAME` -> `TEST_NAME`

`EXAMPLE_TIME` -> `TEST_TIME`

values.description: This adds two more examples: `core_no_deps` and `core_child`. Both of these create a core library from a single `empty.cc` file. The `core_child` package depends on `core_no_deps` and links its core library with `PUBLIC`, so it should be listed in in the `Requires` section of the pkg-config file. This is currently broken (to be fixed by pull request #56), so you can confirm that the test fails.
values.title: More examples: install, create core library, find dependency, check pkg-config requires

summary.raw: This adds two more examples: `core_no_deps` and `core_child`. Both of these create a core library from a single `empty.cc` file. The `core_child` package depends on `core_no_deps` and links its core library with `PUBLIC`, so it should be listed in in the `Requires` section of the pkg-config file. This is currently broken (to be fixed by pull request #56), so you can confirm that the test fails.
summary.html: This adds two more examples: core_no_deps and core_child. Both of these create a core library from a single empty.cc file. The core_child package depends on core_no_deps and links its core library with PUBLIC, so it should be listed in in the Requires section of the pkg-config file. This is currently broken (to be fixed by pull request #56), so you can confirm that the test fails.

The currently does not check components...could use some work.

values.description:
The cmake files for ignition-cmake are architecture-independent, so they can be installed to `share` instead of `lib`.

Also, use `IGN_SHARE_INSTALL_DIR` to simplify other variables. The `@PACKAGE_INIT@` trick is described here:

* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/CMakePackageConfigHelpers.html
values.title: Install cmake files to share instead of lib

summary.raw:
The cmake files for ignition-cmake are architecture-independent, so they can be installed to `share` instead of `lib`.

Also, use `IGN_SHARE_INSTALL_DIR` to simplify other variables. The `@PACKAGE_INIT@` trick is described here:

* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/CMakePackageConfigHelpers.html
summary.html:
The cmake files for ignition-cmake are architecture-independent, so they can be installed to share instead of lib.

Also, use IGN_SHARE_INSTALL_DIR to simplify other variables. The @PACKAGE_INIT@ trick is described here:

  • https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.5/module/CMakePackageConfigHelpers.html

values.description: In order to test doxygen generation in our cmake examples, it's easier to fake-install the doxygen files if they are in a subfolder.
values.title: Fake install part 2: move doxygen files to a subfolder to simplify installation

values.description: Currently the `cmake` code is symlinked to the build folder (like a devel workspace) to test the examples. This PR creates a complete file hierarchy under `FAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` so we can test the doxygen and codecheck files in the examples too.
values.title: Fake install part 1: use complete file hierarchy to test examples

summary.raw: Currently the `cmake` code is symlinked to the build folder (like a devel workspace) to test the examples. This PR creates a complete file hierarchy under `FAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` so we can test the doxygen and codecheck files in the examples too.
summary.html: Currently the cmake code is symlinked to the build folder (like a devel workspace) to test the examples. This PR creates a complete file hierarchy under FAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX so we can test the doxygen and codecheck files in the examples too.

values.title: Doxygen macro for downstream packages (#30)

summary.raw: This converts the `ign_create_docs` macro to a function for setting up doxygen for downstream packages. It takes an argument for tag files to use for linking. Fixes #30.
summary.html: This converts the ign_create_docs macro to a function for setting up doxygen for downstream packages. It takes an argument for tag files to use for linking. Fixes #30.

values.description: Branch coverage was added in pull request #46, but it has made coverage results harder to interpret (see issue #28). This pull request reverts to line coverage by default and adds a target called `coverage-branch` that performs branch coverage for those who are interested.
values.title: Make line coverage by default, add separate coverage-branch target

summary.raw: Branch coverage was added in pull request #46, but it has made coverage results harder to interpret (see issue #28). This pull request reverts to line coverage by default and adds a target called `coverage-branch` that performs branch coverage for those who are interested.
summary.html: Branch coverage was added in pull request #46, but it has made coverage results harder to interpret (see issue #28). This pull request reverts to line coverage by default and adds a target called coverage-branch that performs branch coverage for those who are interested.

values.description:
The xenial debbuilds of the next ign-cmake1 prerelease failed because one of the tests failed:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=9)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/9/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/9/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=10)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/10/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/10/

~~~
11/14 Test #14: core_child_requires_core_no_deps .....***Failed    0.01 sec
Package ignition-core_child was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `ignition-core_child.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
No package 'ignition-core_child' found
Could not detect ignition-core_no_deps requirement
~~~

Due to the debbuild environment, it is using an arch-dependent lib folder:

~~~
-- Installing: <build_folder>/install/Debug/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/pkgconfig/ignition-core_no_deps.pc
~~~

So we should use the `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` instead of hard-coding to `lib`.

@\_jrivero_ tested this patch and it fixes the problem

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/11/
values.title: use CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR in pkg-config example test in case an arch-dependent lib folder is used

summary.raw:
The xenial debbuilds of the next ign-cmake1 prerelease failed because one of the tests failed:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=9)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/9/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/9/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=10)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/10/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/10/

~~~
11/14 Test #14: core_child_requires_core_no_deps .....***Failed    0.01 sec
Package ignition-core_child was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `ignition-core_child.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
No package 'ignition-core_child' found
Could not detect ignition-core_no_deps requirement
~~~

Due to the debbuild environment, it is using an arch-dependent lib folder:

~~~
-- Installing: <build_folder>/install/Debug/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/pkgconfig/ignition-core_no_deps.pc
~~~

So we should use the `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` instead of hard-coding to `lib`.

@\_jrivero_ tested this patch and it fixes the problem

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign-cmake1-debbuilder&build=11)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/11/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/11/
summary.html:
The xenial debbuilds of the next ign-cmake1 prerelease failed because one of the tests failed:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/9/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/10/
11/14 Test #14: core_child_requires_core_no_deps .....***Failed    0.01 sec
Package ignition-core_child was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `ignition-core_child.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
No package 'ignition-core_child' found
Could not detect ignition-core_no_deps requirement

Due to the debbuild environment, it is using an arch-dependent lib folder:

-- Installing: <build_folder>/install/Debug/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/pkgconfig/ignition-core_no_deps.pc

So we should use the CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR instead of hard-coding to lib.

@_jrivero_ tested this patch and it fixes the problem

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-cmake1-debbuilder/11/

values.description:
This is a branch by @nkoenig that refactors the `ign_create_docs` macro to replace the `ign_doxygen` function. It removes the need for a `doc` subfolder in downstream projects, and removes the `add_subdirectory(doc)` call, making it not backwards-compatible with ign-cmake0.

Try with the following branches:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/ign_doxygen_macro
* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/branch/new_cmake_doc

Note that ign-gui is currently using `ign-math4`, and the `libignition-math4-dev` deb doesn't have the doxygen tagfile, so make sure to build ign-math4 as well or update ign-gui to use ign-math5 for this test.
values.title: Refactor ign_create_docs to replace ign_doxygen (update to pull request #65)

summary.raw:
This is a branch by @nkoenig that refactors the `ign_create_docs` macro to replace the `ign_doxygen` function. It removes the need for a `doc` subfolder in downstream projects, and removes the `add_subdirectory(doc)` call, making it not backwards-compatible with ign-cmake0.

Try with the following branches:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/ign_doxygen_macro
* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/branch/new_cmake_doc

Note that ign-gui is currently using `ign-math4`, and the `libignition-math4-dev` deb doesn't have the doxygen tagfile, so make sure to build ign-math4 as well or update ign-gui to use ign-math5 for this test.
summary.html:
This is a branch by @nkoenig that refactors the ign_create_docs macro to replace the ign_doxygen function. It removes the need for a doc subfolder in downstream projects, and removes the add_subdirectory(doc) call, making it not backwards-compatible with ign-cmake0.

Try with the following branches:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/ign_doxygen_macro
  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/branch/new_cmake_doc

Note that ign-gui is currently using ign-math4, and the libignition-math4-dev deb doesn't have the doxygen tagfile, so make sure to build ign-math4 as well or update ign-gui to use ign-math5 for this test.

values.description: This allows us to create header-only (a.k.a. INTERFACE) ignition libraries. The first use-case of this will be the [`eigen3` component of `ign-math`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/256/).
values.title: Enable header-only ignition libraries and components

summary.raw: This allows us to create header-only (a.k.a. INTERFACE) ignition libraries. The first use-case of this will be the [`eigen3` component of `ign-math`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/256/).
summary.html: This allows us to create header-only (a.k.a. INTERFACE) ignition libraries. The first use-case of this will be the eigen3 component of ign-math.

values.description:
During my efforts to build ignition\_rendering on Windows I added support for the GTS cmake module.

I’m testing it in the [ignition rendering job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/169/consoleFull) using vcpkg GTS installation \(no cmake module generated\). 

‌

values.description:
Disabling two cpplint warnings:

‌

1. Ending anonymous namespace brace should end with an inline `// namespace`. We don’t allow inline comments, and this warning doesn’t add anything meaningful to the code.
2.  Internal `.h` header files should include a directory. This is overly strict, and not needed.

‌
values.title: Disable some cpplint codechecks

summary.raw:
Disabling two cpplint warnings:

‌

1. Ending anonymous namespace brace should end with an inline `// namespace`. We don’t allow inline comments, and this warning doesn’t add anything meaningful to the code.
2.  Internal `.h` header files should include a directory. This is overly strict, and not needed.

‌
summary.html:
Disabling two cpplint warnings:

‌

  1. Ending anonymous namespace brace should end with an inline // namespace. We don’t allow inline comments, and this warning doesn’t add anything meaningful to the code.
  2. Internal .h header files should include a directory. This is overly strict, and not needed.

‌

values.description:
With this PR, a project can add a `cppcheck.suppress` file in the project’s build folder to inject cppcheck suppressions.

‌

Example usage: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/137/added-cppcheck-suppressions/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/137/added-cppcheck-suppressions/diff)
values.title: Added cppcheck.suppress to codecheck

summary.raw:
With this PR, a project can add a `cppcheck.suppress` file in the project’s build folder to inject cppcheck suppressions.

‌

Example usage: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/137/added-cppcheck-suppressions/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/137/added-cppcheck-suppressions/diff)
summary.html:
With this PR, a project can add a cppcheck.suppress file in the project’s build folder to inject cppcheck suppressions.

‌

Example usage: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/137/added-cppcheck-suppressions/diff

values.description: We were dereferencing variables in an if-statement when we should have just been passing the variable name itself to the if-statement. This was causing `FindIgnProtobuf.cmake` to fail when it shouldn’t have.

values.description:
This PR changes the name of the Ogre cmake module to IgnOgre. The reason for that is that we could find different distributions shipping FindOgre.cmake modules \(for example vcpkg on Windows\) and I needed a way to make both different.

A better way to see this PR differences is: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/commits/e4e28364ed588c81ad130238c4e0d0b3b5a91102?w=1](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/commits/e4e28364ed588c81ad130238c4e0d0b3b5a91102?w=1)

Testing it in the ign\_render job \(although there are still linker problems related to the own ign\_rendering code\): [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_render\_win/163/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_render_win/163)
values.title: Change Ogre cmake module name to IgnOgre and support for Windows

values.description:
Right now our file structure feels a little unbalanced to me. We have something like:

    src/
    include/
    component1
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component2
    -- src/
    -- include/
    ...etc...

This PR allows ignition projects to \(optionally\) balance this out a bit by accepting the following directory structure:

    core
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component1
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component2
    -- src/
    -- include/
    ...etc...

`gnition-cmake` will check for a top-level `core` directory, and if it fails to find that, it will expect a top-level `src` and `include` directory like what we’ve been using.

This is a backwards-compatible and mostly superficial change. It’s currently being used in the new [ign-plugin](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/src/NewRegistrationScheme/) repo, in case anyone wants to see some example usage.
values.title: Allow core library files to have their own directory

summary.raw:
Right now our file structure feels a little unbalanced to me. We have something like:

    src/
    include/
    component1
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component2
    -- src/
    -- include/
    ...etc...

This PR allows ignition projects to \(optionally\) balance this out a bit by accepting the following directory structure:

    core
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component1
    -- src/
    -- include/
    component2
    -- src/
    -- include/
    ...etc...

`gnition-cmake` will check for a top-level `core` directory, and if it fails to find that, it will expect a top-level `src` and `include` directory like what we’ve been using.

This is a backwards-compatible and mostly superficial change. It’s currently being used in the new [ign-plugin](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/src/NewRegistrationScheme/) repo, in case anyone wants to see some example usage.
summary.html:
Right now our file structure feels a little unbalanced to me. We have something like:

src/
include/
component1
-- src/
-- include/
component2
-- src/
-- include/
...etc...

This PR allows ignition projects to (optionally) balance this out a bit by accepting the following directory structure:

core
-- src/
-- include/
component1
-- src/
-- include/
component2
-- src/
-- include/
...etc...

gnition-cmake will check for a top-level core directory, and if it fails to find that, it will expect a top-level src and include directory like what we’ve been using.

This is a backwards-compatible and mostly superficial change. It’s currently being used in the new ign-plugin repo, in case anyone wants to see some example usage.
